PipeOpUnbranch

Source: R/PipeOpUnBranch.R

Used to bring together different paths created by PipeOpBranch.

PipeOpUnbranch

Format

R6Class object inheriting from PipeOp.

Methods

  • PipeOpUnbranch$new(options, id = "unbranch")
    (numeric(1) | character, character(1)) -> self
    Constructor. If options is an integer number, it determines the number of input channels that are created, named input1...input<n>. If options is a character, it determines the names of channels directly.

Details

Creates a PipeOp with multiple input channels that can be used to create a Graph network with alternative paths. options works as in PipeOpBranch and should probably be the same value as the options given to the corresponding PipeOpBranch instance.

See also

Other PipeOps: PipeOpEnsemble, PipeOpTaskPreproc, PipeOp, mlr_pipeop_NULL, mlr_pipeop_branch, mlr_pipeop_chunk, mlr_pipeop_copy, mlr_pipeop_encode, mlr_pipeop_featureunion, mlr_pipeop_filter, mlr_pipeop_learner, mlr_pipeop_majorityvote, mlr_pipeop_modelavg, mlr_pipeop_nloptmajorityvote, mlr_pipeop_pca, mlr_pipeop_scale, mlr_pipeop_subsample, mlr_pipeop_undersample, mlr_pipeops

Other Path Branching: NO_OP, filter_noop, is_noop, mlr_pipeop_branch

Examples

pca = PipeOpPCA$new()
nop = PipeOpNULL$new()
choices = c("pca", "nothing")
PipeOpBranch$new(choices) %>>% gunion(list(pca, nop)) %>>% PipeOpUnbranch$new(choices)
#> Graph with 4 PipeOps:
#>        ID         State sccssors prdcssors
#>    branch <<UNTRAINED>> pca,null          
#>       pca <<UNTRAINED>> unbranch    branch
#>      null <<UNTRAINED>> unbranch    branch
#>  unbranch <<UNTRAINED>>           pca,null
